ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The reading load, unfortunately, is unrealistic - especially for those with only basic physical sciences background.
I would have liked the professor to reveal more of her expertise on the subject matter. It was great for the class to bestudent driven, but expertise would have been welcome.

While the idea of this course was inspiring, it was ultimately problematic to have make this course a seminar. While the professor was dedicated and engaged, it felt like Nadine was learning along side us. This was pretty problematic when questions would come up in class but a clear answer would not be provided. A lot of the confusion that was raised about aspects of the IPCC report was never really resolved.

This material is so important and everyone in the room who signed up for the class was committed to really understanding the material, butthe format and delivery was a real let down. It's not appropriate to let students say things that are inaccurate without correcting them. I think it would have been better to have presenters meet with the instructor the week before to clarify the material - identify the key figures and really drill down to understand the core questions. Instead listening to 30 minute power points where big points and small points are all just treated superficially is frustrating. I think the instructor really should have taken a more active role in actually teaching the material. Or lean on the university and bring Mark Pagani in for the paleo chapter, Trude for the aerosols, etc. It's such important information I really think this class could have been taught better. Maybe have every student do a reading response each week, or a quiz on the summary, something to get people engaged.
The reading was very intense and difficult to understand. I think that thi class would also be more effective if it was held later in the day to help give full attention toboth presenters

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Sharing the work of reading the IPCC report and getting the "distilled" version of each chapter from the class presentations.
Working on my student presentation- i learned a ton about the issue i signed up for.
The reading

The best part of this course was having the opportunity to translate science into a comprehensible and accessible narrative. It was a rewarding challenge to communicate a technical report to an audience of your peers.
This was a great way to get myself to read the very important information in the IPCC AR5 report, with assistance from others in understanding the complex concepts in it.
The material! Every FES student should read the IPCC report.
Real material and issues!!!! It helped me to understand why it is so hard to convey the science of climate change to the world, and the difficulties of climate research
The course was a great opportunity to learn the AR5 in depth.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Sometimes it seemed like the blind leading the blind. I would rather have heard more insights from Prof. Unger. Maybe a slightly longer class period would be helpful.
Higher expectation of student involvement in other presentations
None
This course could have benefited from a longer class period to allow for both presentation and discussion of the material.

The professor needs to be more well versed in the technical aspects of the IPCC chapters we were all reading so that she can clearly and succinctly answer students' questions. It is an admirable idea to have students teach one another the material but there needs to be a backstop to ensure that what is communicated is correct. I did not feel this was always the case.
Each chapter was taught by a student. Sometimes, if the student did not understand the chapter well, or put together a poor presentation, much of the content was lost.
The structure and setting up a class to never hear from an expert and almost never having an actual discussion....

I think the professor should be more forthcoming when it comes to helping the students who are struggling at points in their presentations. The material is extremely difficult to understand if you've never seen it before, and even harder to explain to others. The whole class would benefit more from the professors knowledge and understanding of the material!!! Sometimes it felt like the students were being punished for not understanding all of the material when it should be more about learning. It would also help if the professor outlined the important take-always from each chapter in handouts to keep as reference!

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Yes, effective.
instructor could provide lecture
NA

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I wanted to be more climate literate in a wider environmental context
NA
As someone interested in climate policy, delving more deeply into the climate science was very helpful.
it is very useful but hard to understand because of too much technicalities involved
Useful to have an opportunity to practice communicating technical scientific information to a broad audience - a skill we all need to develop at FES.
The material in this class was essential for understanding the relevant climate change science as it relates to the economics of sea level rise (my area of study).

Understanding the science of climate change is so important I wish this class was offered in the fall - and it should be paired with more hand holding through the most important science concepts. Maybe even just one concept a week? anything.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Because I was interested to learn the scientific analysis on climate change.
my interest in climate change
I realized how important the IPCC report is and wanted a commitment mechanism for reading it.
I was interested in knowing the substance.
I took this course to get a deep understanding of the IPCC report and the key findings from each chapter.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Well, not really...there's just too much information to really retain.
Yes
Yes

While reading the full IPCC AR5 WGI report chapter by chapter was a useful exercise, I expected to have the Professor lecture and explain more, rather than let the students take primary control of the lessons.
so so
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: NA
NA

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Don't take it unless you're REALLY committed to understanding the IPCC WG1 report, and have a strong background in physical sciences.
Just be ready for all science, all the time. it is purely a science reading course.
You need to have science background to understand the material, otherwise, you need to work hard on your own to understand all the terms and the scientific concepts in the IPCC AR5
needs better understanding of climate change, especially the science part before taking the course
Take it if you are going to be doing anything related to climate change.
Lots of technical reading and early PowerPoints. Important subject matter. Entirely student run
